characters.name: Peter
lines: Stewie, do you know about TCP? It is like the internet's version of a polite talk show host.
It makes sure every message gets to where it is going without spilling the tea!

characters.name: Stewie
lines: So, TCP is like a digital butler, ensuring the internet's important gossip arrives on time?
How does it keep everything so organized?

characters.name: Peter
lines: Exactly! TCP breaks down data into tiny packets, like pieces of a jigsaw puzzle.
It numbers them, sends them off, and makes sure they are all received and put back in order.
If one packet gets lost, it politely asks for a resend. No drama here, just efficiency!

characters.name: Stewie
lines: So, it is like a patient librarian, keeping all the books in order and fetching any that go missing?
I wish my sock drawer was as organized as TCP.
